Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
am
<networking> The {country code} for Armenia.
Used for the {vanity domain} "i.am".
(1999-01-27)

Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
AM
1. <communications> {Amplitude Modulation}.
2. <artificial intelligence> A program by {Doug Lenat} to discover concepts in elementary mathematics. AM was written in 1976 in {Interlisp}. From 100 fundamental concepts and about 250 {heuristics} it discovered several important mathematical concepts including subsets, disjoint sets, sets with the same number of elements, and numbers. It worked by filling slots in {frames} maintaining an agenda of resource-limited prioritised tasks.
AM's successor was {Eurisko}.
{(http://homepages.enterprise.net/hibou/aicourse/lenat.txt)}.
(1999-04-19)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Am \Am\ [AS. am, eom, akin to Gothic im, Icel. em, Olr. am, Lith. esmi, L. sum., Gr. ?, Zend ahmi, Skr. asmi, fr. a root as to be. ?. See {Are}, and cf. {Be}, {Was}.] The first person singular of the verb be, in the indicative mode, present tense. See {Be}. [1913 Webster]
God said unto Moses, I am that am. --Exod. iii. 14. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)
Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)
Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: Am n 1: a radioactive transuranic metallic element; discovered by bombarding uranium with helium atoms [syn: {americium}, {atomic number 95}] 2: a master's degree in arts and sciences [syn: {Master of Arts}, {MA}, {Artium Magister}] 3: modulation of the amplitude of the (radio) carrier wave [syn: {amplitude modulation}]
a.m. adj : before noon [syn: {ante meridiem}] adv : before noon; "let's meet at 11 A.M." [syn: {ante meridiem}]
